alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 24 at 2:15PM PST until February 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Douglas and Jackson County Foothills, the Kalmiopsis Wilderness, and eastern Curry County. This includes Toketee Falls and Butte Falls. This includes Highway 138 east of Steamboat, and portions of Highway 140, 62, and 227. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels could drop as low as 1,500 feet through this time frame, bringing a chance for snow at lower elevations. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
